register.name: R0
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R1
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R2
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R3
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R4
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R5
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R6
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R7
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R8
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R9
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R10
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R11
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: R12
register.description: General-purpose register

register.name: SP
register.description: Exception and procedure stack pointer register

register.name: LR
register.description: Exception and procedure call link register

register.name: PC
register.description: Holds the current program counter value

register.name: XPSR
register.description: Provides access to a combination of the APSR, EPSR and IPSR

register.name: APSR
register.description: Provides privileged and unprivileged access to the PE Execution state fields

register.name: BASEPRI
register.description: Changes the priority level required for exception preemption

register.name: BASEPRI_NS
register.description: Changes the priority level required for exception preemption

register.name: BASEPRI_S
register.description: Changes the priority level required for exception preemption

register.name: CONTROL
register.description: Provides access to the PE control fields

register.name: CONTROL_NS
register.description: Provides access to the PE control fields

register.name: CONTROL_S
register.description: Provides access to the PE control fields

register.name: EPSR
register.description: Holds Execution state bits

register.name: EXC_RETURN
register.description: Value provided in LR on entry to an exception, and used with a BX or load to PC to perform an exception return

register.name: FAULTMASK
register.description: Provides access to the PE FAULTMASK register

register.name: FAULTMASK_NS
register.description: Provides access to the PE FAULTMASK register

register.name: FAULTMASK_S
register.description: Provides access to the PE FAULTMASK register

register.name: FNC_RETURN
register.description: Value provided in LR on entry to Non-secure state from a Secure BL or BLX

register.name: FPSCR
register.description: Provides control of the floating-point system

bitField.name: DZC
bitField.description: Divide by Zero cumulative exception bit

register.name: IPSR
register.description: Provides privileged access to the current exception number field

register.name: MAIR_ATTR
register.description: Defines the memory attribute encoding for use in the MPU_MAIR0 and MPU_MAIR1

register.name: MSP
register.description: MSP

register.name: MSP_NS
register.description: MSP_NS

register.name: MSP_S
register.description: MSP_S

register.name: MSPLIM
register.description: Holds the lower limit of the Main stack pointer

register.name: MSPLIM_NS
register.description: Holds the lower limit of the Main stack pointer

register.name: MSPLIM_S
register.description: Holds the lower limit of the Main stack pointer

register.name: PRIMASK
register.description: Provides access to the PE PRIMASK register

register.name: PRIMASK_NS
register.description: Provides access to the PE PRIMASK register

register.name: PRIMASK_S
register.description: Provides access to the PE PRIMASK register

register.name: PSP
register.description: PSP

register.name: PSP_NS
register.description: PSP_NS

register.name: PSP_S
register.description: PSP_S

register.name: PSPLIM
register.description: Holds the lower limit for the Process stack pointer

register.name: PSPLIM_NS
register.description: Holds the lower limit for the Process stack pointer

register.name: PSPLIM_S
register.description: Holds the lower limit for the Process stack pointer

register.name: RETPSR
register.gui_name: Combined Exception Return Program Status Registers
register.description: Value pushed to the stack on exception entry. On exception return this is used to restore the flags and other architectural state. This payload is also used for FNC_RETURN stacking, however in this case only some of the fields are used. See FunctionReturn() for details.

register.name: SP_NS
register.description: Provides access to the current Non-secure stack pointer

register.name: TT_RESP
register.description: Provides the response information from a TT, TTA, TTT, or TTAT instruction

tcf:enumItem.description: No carry occurred, or last bit shifted was clear
tcf:enumItem.name: No_carry_occurred_or_last_bit_shifted_was_clear

tcf:enumItem.description: Carry occurred, or last bit shifted was set
tcf:enumItem.name: Carry_occurred_or_last_bit_shifted_was_set

tcf:enumItem.description: Saturation or overflow has not occurred since bit was last cleared
tcf:enumItem.name: Saturation_or_overflow_has_not_occurred_since_bit_was_last_cleared

tcf:enumItem.description: Saturation or overflow has occurred since bit was last cleared
tcf:enumItem.name: Saturation_or_overflow_has_occurred_since_bit_was_last_cleared

tcf:enumItem.description: The floating-point registers do not contain state that belongs to the Secure state
tcf:enumItem.name: The_floating_point_registers_do_not_contain_state_that_belongs_to_the_Secure_state

tcf:enumItem.description: The floating-point registers contain state that belongs to the Secure state
tcf:enumItem.name: The_floating_point_registers_contain_state_that_belongs_to_the_Secure_state

tcf:enumItem.description: Use SP_main as the current stack
tcf:enumItem.name: Use_SP_main_as_the_current_stack

tcf:enumItem.description: In Thread mode use SP_process as the current stack
tcf:enumItem.name: In_Thread_mode_use_SP_process_as_the_current_stack

tcf:enumItem.description: Thread mode has unprivileged access only
tcf:enumItem.name: Thread_mode_has_unprivileged_access_only

tcf:enumItem.description: Execution of any instruction generates an INVSTATE UsageFault
tcf:enumItem.name: Execution_of_any_instruction_generates_an_INVSTATE_UsageFault

tcf:enumItem.description: Stacking of the callee saved registers skipped
tcf:enumItem.name: Stacking_of_the_callee_saved_registers_skipped

tcf:enumItem.description: Default rules for stacking the callee registers followed
tcf:enumItem.name: Default_rules_for_stacking_the_callee_registers_followed

tcf:enumItem.description: Compare result was not less than
tcf:enumItem.name: Compare_result_was_not_less_than

tcf:enumItem.description: Compare result was not less than
tcf:enumItem.name: Compare_result_was_not_less_than

tcf:enumItem.description: NaN operands propagate through to the output of a floating-point operation
tcf:enumItem.name: NaN_operands_propagate_through_to_the_output_of_a_floating_point_operation

tcf:enumItem.description: Any operation involving one of more NaNs returns the Default NaN
tcf:enumItem.name: Any_operation_involving_one_of_more_NaNs_returns_the_Default_NaN

tcf:enumItem.description: Flush-to-zero mode disabled. Behavior of the floating-point system is fully compliant with the IEEE754 standard
tcf:enumItem.name: Flush_to_zero_mode_disabled

tcf:enumItem.description: Input Denormal exception has not occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Input_Denormal_exception_has_not_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Input Denormal exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Input_Denormal_exception_has_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Inexact exception has not occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Inexact_exception_has_not_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Inexact exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Inexact_exception_has_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Underflow exception has not occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Underflow_exception_has_not_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Underflow exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Underflow_exception_has_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Overflow exception has not occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Overflow_exception_has_not_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Overflow exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Overflow_exception_has_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Division by Zero exception has not occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Division_by_Zero_exception_has_not_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Division by Zero exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Division_by_Zero_exception_has_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Invalid Operation exception has not occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Invalid_Operation_exception_has_not_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: Invalid Operation exception has occurred since 0 was last written to this bit
tcf:enumItem.name: Invalid_Operation_exception_has_occurred_since_0_was_last_written_to_this_bit

tcf:enumItem.description: PE in Handler mode in given exception number. On a function call from Secure state the value is set to 1 to ensure that the Non-secure state cannot determine which exception handler is executing.
tcf:enumItem.name: PE_in_Handler_mode_in_given_exception_number

tcf:enumItem.description: Boosts execution priority to either 0 or 0x80
tcf:enumItem.name: Boosts_execution_priority_to_either_0_or_0x80

tcf:enumItem.description: The stack pointer was 8-byte aligned before exception entry began, no special handling is required on exception return.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_stack_pointer_was_8_byte_aligned_before_exception_entry_began_no_special_handling_is_required_on_exception_return

tcf:enumItem.description: The stack pointer was only 4-byte aligned before exception entry. The exception entry realigned SP to 8-byte alignment by increasing the stack frame size by 4-bytes.
tcf:enumItem.name: The_stack_pointer_was_only_4_byte_aligned_before_exception_entry
